examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: This store is famous for its bait and switch tactics.
The famous author made a mint from royalties on his best-selling books.
The Black Forest in Germany is famous for its beautiful scenery and delicious cake.
I saw a famous actress at the shopping mall today.
My sister's famous sweet cherry jam is a family favorite.
words.defineEn: known by a lot of people

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
Good wine can make a meal.
Memories of that day still bring a lump to his throat.
The brunch special featured a beefburger with a sunny-side-up egg, crispy bacon, and a dollop of hollandaise sauce.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
words.defineEn: used when we want to talk about a person or thing for the first time or when other people may not know who or what they are
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi chúng ta muốn nói về một người hoặc vật lần đầu tiên hoặc khi những người khác có thể không biết họ là ai hoặc cái gì

examples: The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
The new loan takes the total debt to $100 000.
The new president takes office in January.
Fans have given the band's new song their seal of approval.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
words.defineVi: được xây dựng, phát minh, chế tạo gần đây, v.v.

examples: His carelessness lost him the job.
Jobs that pay £5 an hour.
This job puts years on you.
My job is the tough one.
The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
words.defineEn: the work that we do regularly to earn money
words.defineVi: công việc mà chúng tôi làm thường xuyên để kiếm tiền

words.defineEn: to legally become someone's wife or husband
words.defineVi: để hợp pháp trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của một ai đó

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to be introduced to a person; to see and talk to a person for the first time
words.defineVi: được giới thiệu với một người; gặp và nói chuyện với một người lần đầu tiên

examples: Somebody get a doctor!
Did somebody call my name?
To take somebody’s temperature.
to let somebody into the house.
To take a shot at somebody/something.
words.defineEn: a person whose identity is not specified or known
words.defineVi: một người có danh tính không được chỉ định hoặc được biết đến
để bắt đầu yêu ai đó sâu sắc

examples: This type of heater uses a lot of electricity.
Every relationship has a lot of ups and downs.
The entrepreneur received a lot of feedback from friends and family on her new business idea.
The years of stagnation did a lot of harm to the younger generation.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
words.defineEn: people or things in large numbers or amounts
words.defineVi: người hoặc vật với số lượng lớn hoặc số lượng

examples: The business is losing money.
Money can't buy happiness.
Money means nothing to him.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
words.defineEn: something that people use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
words.defineVi: thứ mà mọi người sử dụng để mua và bán hàng hóa và dịch vụ, có thể ở dạng tiền xu hoặc hóa đơn giấy

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineVi: để trải qua hoặc kinh nghiệm một cái gì đó

examples: They still have some surprises up their sleeves.
As a loving husband, he surprises his wife with romantic gestures on special occasions.
They were surprised by the unique taste of burdock chips, a healthier alternative to regular potato chips.
I planned a surprise party for my little sister's birthday.
He surprised his guests at a dinner party by presenting a unique dessert twist on cheese fondue.
words.defineEn: a mild feeling of shock we have when something unusual happens
words.defineVi: một cảm giác sốc nhẹ mà chúng ta có khi có điều gì đó bất thường xảy ra

examples: The town is three miles away.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
words.defineEn: used when naming, or giving description or information about people, things, or situations
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi đặt tên hoặc đưa ra mô tả hoặc thông tin về người, sự vật hoặc tình huống

examples: You’ll be lucky!
Thanks, I'm so lucky to have you.
We were lucky to witness a herd of elephants grazing peacefully in the savannah.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
It's lucky I was sent here, to Hepzibah, or I'd be pushing up daisies.
words.defineVi: có hoặc mang lại may mắn

examples: Travel broadens the mind.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
They travelled the highways and byways of Britain.
The news traveled across the country like lightning.
His travels brought him into contact with many famous artists.
words.defineEn: to go from one location to another, particularly to a far location
words.defineVi: đi từ địa điểm này sang địa điểm khác, đặc biệt là đến một địa điểm xa

examples: She moved her queen.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
She moved the tray to a side table.
We moved our chairs a little nearer.
She moved the ball toward the opponent's goal.
words.defineEn: to go from one place to another; to change position
words.defineVi: đi từ nơi này đến nơi khác; để thay đổi vị trí

examples: The police searched the suspect's house for evidence.
Houses that suits every pocket.
The house looks east.
Better one house spoiled than two.
The singer always brings the house down with her powerful voice and stage presence.
words.defineEn: a building where people live, especially as a family
words.defineVi: một tòa nhà nơi mọi người sống, đặc biệt là như một gia đình
